style.name: Brown Porter
style.description: Brown porters are mid to dark brown (may have red tint) in color. No roast barley or strong burnt/black malt character should be perceived. Low to medium malt sweetness, caramel and chocolate is acceptable along with medium hop bitterness. This is a lightto medium-bodied beer. Fruity esters are acceptable. Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being negligible to medium in character.

breweries.name: Broad Ripple Brewing
breweries.description: The Broad Ripple Brewpub, established in 1990, was the first Brewpub in Indiana and is the oldest microbrewery currently operating in the state.  Our beers have won many awards over the years and we've been named Best Brewpub by both the restaurant reviewers and readers of every local publication dozens of times, making us the most decorated Brewpub, and one of the most well loved restaurants in the city of Indianapolis.

data.description: Dark and rich, Sierra Nevada Porter is a delicious, medium-bodied ale with a creamy head. The Porter’s smooth flavor (malty with hints of caramel) comes from a blend of deep-roasted barley malts.

breweries.name: Sierra Nevada Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Sierra Nevada Brewing Company was established in 1980 by homebrewers Ken Grossman and Paul Camusi. Camusi retired in 1998 and sold his share in the company to Grossman.

Located in Chico, California, Sierra Nevada Brewing is one of the most popular craft breweries currently operating in the United States. Its Pale Ale is world renowned, and the brewery produces almost 700,000 barrels of beer per year. Sierra Nevada's Pale Ale is the second best-selling craft beer in the United States, behind the Boston Beer Company's Samuel Adams Boston Lager.

Sierra Nevada's specialty brews include the winter seasonal Celebration, which is similar to the pale ale, but hoppier; and Summerfest, a lager which is citrusy and sunny.

data.name: Porter
data.description: Porter gains it’s robust, full-bodied flavor from dark rich barley malts. We use a blend of munich, crystal, pale ale, black patent and chocolate malts. To these we add hops, filtered water and ale yeast. No adjuncts, additives or preservatives… Not pasteurized.

breweries.name: Palmetto Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Opened by Ed Falkenstein and Louis Bruce in 1993 to create a locally-brewed alternative to domestic and import beers, Palmetto is South Carolina's oldest brewery and the first to open in the state since Prohibition. We make four year-round styles of beer, with every batch brewed in our twenty-five barrel brewing system.

Ed and Louis started making great beers after a windsurfing trip to Hood River Oregon. After finding inspiration and realizing that Charleston needed some better beer, they set up shop on Huger Street and have been brewing up trouble ever since. 

Wanna come see us?

Tasting Room hours are:
Tues-Thurs 3pm - 9pm
Fri-Sat 1pm - 10pm

breweries.name: 961 BEER
breweries.description:
961 Beer began during the dark days of the July 2006 siege on Lebanon. Tired with the lack of quality beer in Lebanon, Mazen Hajjar and his friends started to brew beer in his very own kitchen. The first batches were brewed in 20 liter kettles. Granted that war and blockades are not the ideal conditions to start a company, alongside everyone telling them they were mad to even consider it, they went ahead with it anyway. They decided that brewing a good beer for a great country was what they wanted to do the most.

When 961 Beer officially began brewing they were one of the smallest breweries in the world, and the only microbrewery in the Middle East (and still are). Although 961 Beer now brews nearly 2 million liters per year, they still insist upon making beer using the very same principles: traditional techniques, quality ingredients and love.

data.name: Porter
data.description: No other beer shows off what malts can do in a beer better than porter. Certified Organic Porter uses a complex blend of five malts that compliment and highlight one another in a harmonious mixture. Only one addition of imported Pacific Gem hops is used to provide a balancing bitterness without introducing any other hop character. While decidedly in the robust porter category, Certified Organic Porter has none of the harsh character people often associate with dark ales. Instead, what one finds is a rich, smooth beer with suggestions of chocolate and just a hint of coffee. So smooth and malty, this porter will convert even the non-dark beer drinker.

breweries.name: Pyramid Breweries
breweries.description: Based in the Pacific Northwest, Pyramid Breweries began as Hart Brewing in 1984 and launched the flagship brand of Pyramid Ales.  In 1996, the company was reborn as Pyramid Breweries and currently offers craft beers produced under the Pyramid family of ales and lagers.  With breweries in Seattle, WA, Portland, OR, and Berkeley, CA, Pyramid also owns Alehouses at all three locations and an additional Alehouse in Walnut Creek, CA.

breweries.name: The Sprig & Fern Brewery
breweries.description:
In brewing, as in many things in life, what you put in effects what comes out. Our brewing philosophy is simple - we use quality ingredients and work very hard to ensure quality and consistency. We source our hops and cider apples locally, and our malts from suppliers in both the South and North Islands. Our specialty malts that provide the colour and flavour for some of our different beer styles are sourced from South Canterbury, Germany and the United Kingdom. We use the local town supply water, which is extremely good quality for our beer and cider production.

Our beers and ciders are produced using all natural ingredients and are unpasteurised to retain their full flavour. We call it 'Real Live Beer' and encourage you to keep it well refrigerated to maintain quality and freshness.

data.name: Porter
data.description: Dark brown complexion and silky smooth body brewed with 2 Row and Black Barley, Maltodextrine, Lactose(milk sugar), Crystal and Chocolate Malts. Wonderfully-balanced flavors of chocolate, caramel and coffee. Complex yet not too heavy, as you enjoy this beer its flavors evolve as it warms up a bit.

breweries.name: Big E Ales
breweries.description: Our unique, cozy and family-friendly brewpub is tucked away in a small industrial park in Lynnwood, WA. We have been at this location producing our handcrafted ales since 2005. We take pride in serving our patrons more than just a quick beer or a bite to eat; we want to build friendships that go beyond the bar. Beer to us is something that bonds and brings people together from all walks of life. We specialize in transforming your events and parties either at our brewery or your home into an impressive beer experience. Our dispensing systems are not only innovative and efficient, they will enhance your party and will impress your guests…they will be talking about the amazing beer and the cool “party pig” long after your party. Over the past 5 years we have grown from a small production brewery with a tasting room into a neighborhood hangout. Come in and enjoy one of our handcrafted beverages in our cedar lined pub or out in our beer garden, oh and don’t forget to order our Big “E” Signature Reuben. Next time you are faced with a “Beer Emergency” either personal or with your friends come down to the Big “E” and we will help bail you out.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: Tuesday- Saturday 11:00 AM to 10:00 PM

data.name: Porter
data.description:
With deep black color, a thick, creamy head, rich chocolate, toffee and coffee flavors, and full-bodied smoothness, Anchor Porter® is the epitome of a handcrafted dark beer.

A blend of specially roasted pale, caramel, chocolate, and black malts, along with our top-fermenting yeast, creates complexity without bitterness. The brew is hopped at a high rate, and naturally carbonated. The result is dark in the glass, but surprisingly light on the palate.

Anchor Porter® became the first modern American porter when it was introduced in 1972. As we celebrate its 40th anniversary, our porter continues to reward those who look beyond its intimidating appearance to discover its smooth, full-bodied drinkability. Anchor Porter® is the definitive American Porter.

breweries.name: Anchor Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Anchor Brewing Company’s roots date back to the California gold rush making it one of America’s oldest breweries. Its Anchor Steam® Beer is San Francisco’s original since 1896. 

In 1965, Fritz Maytag acquired and revived the struggling brewery at a time when mass production of beer dominated and seemed unstoppable. Maytag started a revolution in beer that originated today’s craft beer movement. 
An undisputed icon, Anchor is America’s first craft brewery where beers are handmade in our traditional copper brewhouse from an all-malt mash. At Anchor, we practice the time-honored art of classical brewing, employing state-of-the-art methods to ensure that our beers are always pure and fresh. We know of no brewery in the world that matches our efforts to combine traditional, natural brewing with such carefully applied, modern methods of sanitation, finishing, packaging and transporting.

data.name: Porter
data.description: A touch of roasted barley adds color to the darker caramel malt in our interpretation of a porter. Mt. Hood and Tettnang hops take the place of traditional English hops to move this beer off the English Isle and closer to our side of The Pond.

breweries.name: Gentile Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Gentile Brewing Company is a family-owned and operated nano craft brewery located north of Boston in Beverly, Massachusetts. Founded in 2015 by Beverly residents Paul and Christen Gentile, we are focused on providing our community with fresh craft beer made with quality ingredients. We believe good beer should be enjoyed and not fussed over. Our beer is made using traditional English-style brewing methods and ingredients. Our product line includes a set of four year-round beers and small batch releases that give us a chance to try out new ideas. Our low ABV year-round beers allow you to enjoy more than one without feeling like you were hit by a truck the next day.

Gentile Brewing Company can be easily found in downtown Beverly, steps from the Beverly Depot MBTA station. The building at 59 Park Street was built in 1884 and originally housed Creesy Shoe Factory, among many other manufacturers over its storied 130 plus year history. Our beers pay homage to those who worked and lived in the Beverly community all of those years ago. We hope you’ll come visit us soon!

Paul & Christen Gentile

breweries.name: Snipes Mountain Microbrewery & Restaurant
breweries.description:
Walk between six tall lodge poles that flank the entrance of Snipes Mountain Brewery & Restaurant, push open the big double doors, and come on in. A unique pub and dining experience is waiting for you.

Find a seat at the oak bar, in front of the fireplace, or on the wrap-around patio.

Designed to reflect the surrounding countryside, there's plenty of wide open spaces for everyone. Separate banquet rooms are also available and children are always welcome!

data.name: Porter
data.description: Back East Porter is a full-bodied chestnut brown porter with notes of chocolate and caramel. This hearty beer offers a thick light brown head and is hopped just enough to offset the sweet maltiness and roasty undertones. This bold beer is refreshing enough to be enjoyed year round, but is at its best as a satisfying winter warmer or paired with a grilled steak, pork roast, or a burger.

data.name: Porter
data.description:
Slick, suave, smooth: Our Dark Malt Porter is a seducer, overflowing with dark instincts.

 Featuring notes of espresso and cocoa with a subtle, dry finish, the Porter is a favourite for customers, connoisseurs, beer reviewers and writers. Robustly rich, creamy and smooth, Porter pairs just as well with a steak dinner or a triple-chocolate cake.

breweries.name: Scuttlebutt Brewing Company
breweries.description: Scuttlebutt beers are brewed with the Northwest’s finest ingredients - barley from Vancouver (WA), hops from Yakima and Mabton (WA), a proprietary yeast from Odell, (OR) and some of the nation’s finest drinking water from the Spada Reservoir in the Cascade Mountains. We look forward to many years of brewing consistent, high quality beers as well as discovering new fun beers that will please your taste buds as well as ours.

breweries.name: High Desert Brewing Co.
breweries.description: After years of recipe development, remodeling, and parking lot paving, the High Desert Brewing Co. opened it's doors in July of 1997 and has quickly become one of New Mexico's premier brewpubs. Our selection of hand crafted lagers and ales are produced on premises using the finest grains and hops. We brew small batches of about 100 gallons, ensuring that each beer is served at the peak of freshness. Our brews are available by the glass, pint, or pitcher and to-go in 1/2 gallon growlers and 5 gallon kegs. We make every attempt to keep all of our beers on tap at all times but once in a while one or two may not be available for a few days. These times are the perfect opportunity to stretch your taste and try something other than your favorite. Please let Bob or Donna, or any of the High Desert Brewing Co. staff know how you think we are doing.

breweries.name: Taps Fish House & Brewery
breweries.description:
TAPS Fish House & Brewery was founded in 1999. Many of our beers reflect the classic brewing traditions of Europe, including England, Germany, and Belgium, while others are indicative of the creativity and innovation that are the hallmarks of the American Craft Beer scene.

TAPS’ repertoire of ales and lagers is highly varied and reflects a nod to tradition with a focus on perfection and innovation. The brewing team produces approximately 3000 kegs, or 46,500 gallons of beer annually. Our brewers supply TAPS in Brea, Corona and Irvine, as well as our sister restaurants, The Catch in Anaheim and Lillie’s Q in Brea Downtown. TAPS also distributes fine beers to restaurants and pubs throughout Southern California. We have received national and international acclaim for barrel-aging programs, which produce cult classics such as Remy’s Pappy.

We source the finest ingredients from around the world and utilize the best brewing procedures to create truly great beer: “World Class in Every Glass.” The hops and barley are meticulously sourced in order to emulate the fine beers and brewing regions of the world.  We utilize proprietary strains of yeast, reverse osmosis filtration, and tailor our water chemistry and processes every time beer is made.

TAPS’ passion for perfection has been recognized on the regional, state, national and international levels—to date we have received over 87 medals for our fine beers. TAPS barrel-aged products have also garnered national and international acclaim and are treasured by collectors worldwide

breweries.name: Anacortes Brewery
breweries.description: Our brewers focus on high quality ingredients, a carefully controlled process and delicate handling to provide one of the best beers you will find in the industry. We operate a seven barrel brewery designed and installed by Sound Brewing Systems of Seattle with vessels fabricated by Ripley Stainless in British Columbia. Our brewery features a cold room specially designed for lagering to provide our beers with a traditional character and complexity.

Low to medium malt sweetness, caramel and chocolate is acceptable along with medium hop bitterness. This is a lightto medium-bodied beer. Fruity esters are acceptable. Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being negligible to medium in character.

breweries.name: Mikkeller
breweries.description:
The story of Mikkeller is the story of two homebrewers that in a few years went from hobby brewing in the kitchen to national and international recognition.

Since the summer of 2007, Mikkel Borg Bjergsø, has run Mikkeller on his own. Mikkel is a gipsy-brewer, who brews at different breweries in Denmark, around Europe and the United States.

breweries.name: Wiper and True
breweries.description: A Bristol based brewery. Find our beer at destinations across the country and further afield. We hope you enjoy the drinking as much as we did the brewing.

data.name: Porter - In The Forest
data.description: A traditional Bristol Porter with a Wiper and True touch. Aged on blackberries and blackcurrants and hopped with the Bramling Cross, this has a subtle forest berry taste that complements the rich chocolate and soft roast flavours. Ready to enjoy now but will also cellar well.

breweries.name: Somerville Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Slumbrew is all about the synergy between craft products and every day consumption. Well conceived, locally-sourced, quality products should be an every day part of our lives – not a unique occurrence. This is the spirit of Slumbrew.

Slumbrew is the research & development brand and concept of Somerville Brewing Company. Our mission is to brew unique, ingredient-driven beers that challenge common notions of what a beer should taste like. It is the result of nearly 15 years of beer travel and research by Caitlin Jewell and Jeff Leiter; and a decade of Jeff’s homebrewing recipe formulation.

We produce a lot of small-run, pilot beers at the Slumbrew Beerlab, but only a small number make their way to commercial production. The Somerville Brewing Company contracts with regional breweries to make the best recipes for wide-spread commercial release, but each recipe is an evolving process of refinement. This model for beer production provides an opportunity to experiment with innovative local ingredients to produce craft beers that stand apart from typical formulations.

A crafty brewery in HouTex. Our proximity to Minute Maid Park, Toyota Center & Dynamo Stadium, makes 8W the craft beer for the home team. 

We are dedicated to brewing fresh, tasty artisanal ales.

breweries.name: Wisconsin Brewing Company
breweries.description:
he Wisconsin Brewing Company brewhouse we're building is an exciting mixture of old world, artisan craftsmanship and state-of-the art brewing technology. Built in Hudson, WI, our German-engineered Huppmann Brewhouse will be capable of producing in excess of 100,000 barrels of Wisconsin craft beer annually. The tradition and history behind Huppmann goes back more than 130 years—perfect for true craft beer.

In addition to a great brew house, we have a one-barrel Pilot Brewery on site to develop many of our beers, as well as an event center for parties and other events. The event center also has a gift shop, where you can buy Wisconsin Brewing Company apparel, gift items, and of course, beer.

Put all these pieces together next to a scenic pond with access to bike trails and plenty of beautiful landscape and you can have one heck of a brewery experience.

breweries.name: Hank Is Wiser Brewery
breweries.description: Hank is Wiser Brewery is a small family owned and operated brewpub located in the middle of downtown Cheney, Kansas.  The first house brewed beer was served on April 1, 2005 at their grand opening, just mere hours after Hank Sanford retired from a 22 year sales career in Wichita.  It was 35 years earlier that Hank had purchased his first beer sign.  Collecting brewery advertising, visiting over 300 breweries across the country, homebrewing for the last 15 years, and of course tasting well over 2000 different beers all lead to the dream and finally the reality of opening Hank is Wiser Brewery.

data.name: Porter Pounder
data.description: The Ass Kisser Port Pounder is a dark rich balanced ale that is smooth and yet structured with light coffee and mocha aromas,  The subtile smokey aroma lures your palate to sip though the dark tan head.  Enjoy with grilled and spiced foods.

breweries.name: Ass Kisser Ales
breweries.description:
Ass Kisser Beverage Company is based in Fort Worth, Texas. We are a family owned company from South Australia. It is operated by Rocland Wine Imports. The Ales are brewed at our brewery in San Jose, CA. 

The Line includes a Double IPA, Smoked Porter, Vanilla Pale Ale, Hefewiezen and a Strawberry Wit. 

Ass Kisser Ales is a state of mind. Just as you contemplate the flavors and aromas of this fine ale, you can comtemplate sharing it with your friend or your boss. Maybe they are one in the same or maybe not! We are Just Sayin!

data.name: Porter Rico
data.description: Take a trip to the lost island of Porter Rico, where the cacao and coconut live in harmony and frolic the sandy shores. Our island getaway takes the form of a dark, chocolatey beer, with a balancing sweetness, medium body, and lingering mouthfeel. Intense toasted coconut rides the trade winds for a truly exotic, yet comfortingly familiar pint.

breweries.name: Arcadia Ales
breweries.description:
Arcadia Ales was established in 1996 as a microbrewery specializing in handcrafted British-style ales. All of our beers are produced in small batches, and our 25 Barrel Peter Austin Brewery and methods originated in England, which allows this style of beer to reflect over 250 years of world class brewing heritage.

In addition to brewing on authentic British equipment, Arcadia uses only the finest malted barley from England, and when combined with the freshest hops from the Pacific Northwest of our United States, and our legendary Ringwood yeast, the result is some of the best and freshest handcrafted ales available, on any continent.

breweries.name: Pigskin Brewing Company
breweries.description: Pigskin is more than a name, it’s an idea. Pigskin represents a feeling, a raw emotion, and a sense of total satisfaction. We deliver a feeling of “Victory in every sip.” It is our tagline and also our foundation. We offer exquisitely crafted beers that satisfy every fan like they just won the big game. We are committed to the “Pigskin Experience”: a top notch taproom and brewery, world class hospitality, and some of the best damn beers in the land. So come join us at Pigskin to watch the game, celebrate after a day of dominating at work, or just kick back and enjoy the high-quality beer you deserve!

data.name: Porterluma
data.description: Porters were the first industrialized beers and this Brown Porter is meant to convey the industrial side of an otherwise pastoral Petaluma. British pale and brown malts are complimented with a mixture of English and German hops. Saaz hops working their shift after the British ale yeast make Porterluma a very flavorful and easy-drinking ale.

breweries.name: Petaluma Hills Brewing Co
breweries.description:
A 10 BBL micro brewery in Petaluma, CA.  We have 10 regular craft beers on the market, with the occasional seasonal and "let's make something cool!" beer.

Visit our small, cozy den - uh, taproom - and enjoy all of our craft beers plus 6 versions on nitro!  We don't have a kitchen, so you are welcome to bring your own food.  Kid and dog friendly (leashes, please).

breweries.name: Big Bay Brewing Company
breweries.description:
At Big Bay Brewing we believe that life on the water is a little sweeter. And that sweet life is infused in every beverage we create. To us, life on the water means creating and savoring memories and moments that are cherished for a lifetime. And what better way to enhance those memories and moments than with the right beverage to sip and savor. 

The founders of Big Bay have a strong fundamental belief that craft brewed beverages and life on the water go hand in hand. Alone, what we drink is just sustenance, but paired with the right sights, sounds and settings, it becomes part of a much larger experience. And we are dedicated to bringing the “experience” back to brewing. After all, our personal life experiences have played a leading role in developing Big Bay Brewing. And as we grow, we invite you to be a part of Big Bay by sharing your experiences with us. In other words, we want you to be a part of the sweet life with us.
